critique: This document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act during the Franklin D. Roosevelt administration. It approves Chapter III of the Code of Fair Competition for the Construction Industry, specifically related to the Painting, Paperhanging, and Decorating Division. Given the context of the New Deal era, the document reflects a strong government intervention in the economy. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. Therefore, these axes will be scored as neutral. The document reflects a liberal approach to economic regulation.
